meanings.definition: To form into grains or small particles.
meanings.sent1: She was granulating the sugar to make it finer for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The artist was granulating the clay to create a textured surface.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled the salt, granulating the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: The rain was granulating the sand, turning it into a rough surface.
meanings.sent5: The machine was granulating the plastic into tiny beads for recycling.
